strings.string: Show Side Menu when it is not focused
Reset all skin settings to default
Show scrollbar in views when it is not focused
Show artwork thumbnail when playing media
Show the Revolve Title Screen on startup
Group items in the Side Menu
Show names in Thumbnails and Panels views
Enable the Music Videos option in the Home Menu. This option will only be visible in the Home Menu if your library contains at least one music video.
Enable the display of images, both Revolve artwork and fanart, in the background.
Enable the fading of the images that are shown in the background. Faded background images improve the readability of the information on screen.
Enable music visualisation in the background. If music visualisation is disabled, Revolve will display background images (if those are enabled).
Enable the fading of music visualisation in the background. Faded music visualisation improves the readability of the information on screen.
Enable video playback in the background. If video playback is disabled, Revolve will display background images (if those are enabled).
Enable the fading of video playback in the background. Faded video playback improves the readability of the information on screen. Full screen video playback is not affected by this setting.
Edit this pre-defined option. You can set the action that is executed when this option is chosen in the Home Menu.
Enable this custom option in the Home Menu. You should provide a name and an action to make this custom option do something useful.
Edit this custom option. You can set the name and subtitle of the option, and you can enter the action that is executed when this option is chosen in the Home Menu.
Enable the Books option in the Home Menu.
Enable the Games option in the Home Menu.
Enable the Favourites option in the Home Menu.
Enable the Videos option in the Home Menu.
Enable the Movies option in the Home Menu. This option will only be visible in the Home Menu if your library contains at least one movie.
Enable the TV Shows option in the Home Menu. This option will only be visible in the Home Menu if your library contains at least one tv show.
Enable the Music option in the Home Menu.
Enable the Pictures option in the Home Menu.
Enable the Programs option in the Home Menu.
Enable the Weather option in the Home Menu.
Enable the File Manager option in the Home Menu.
Enable the Add-ons option in the Home Menu. You can always manage your add-ons through the Add-ons option in the Settings menu.
Enable the Settings option in the Home Menu. You should realize that it is hard to change these settings without this option!
Enable the Exit option in the Home Menu. You might need this option to exit Kodi.
Do not completely hide the side menu when it is not focused. An invisible side menu gives Revolve a cleaner look, but there is no longer a visual clue that suggests the presence of a side menu.

Enable the Live TV option in the Home Menu. This option will only be visible in the Home Menu if the Personal Video Recorder (PVR) features are enabled. You can enable these PVR features in the Live TV settings.
Show the 'No information available' messages if there is no information available.
Enable the (Play) Disc option in the Home Menu. This option will only be visible in the Home Menu if there is a disc in the drive of your Kodi device.

Do not completely hide the scrollbar in the views when it is not focused. An invisible scrollbar gives Revolve a cleaner look, but there is no longer a visual clue that suggests the presence of the scrollbar.
Enable the Albums option in the Home Menu. This option will only be visible in the Home Menu if your library contains some music.
Set the add-on that can provide lyrics for your music.
Show the artwork for the currently playing media in the lower right corner of the screen in most Kodi windows. Hiding this artwork gives Revolve a cleaner but slightly boring look.
Enable an on-screen grid that you can use to place and align elements of this skin.
Enable on-screen debug information that shows the currently active window and dialogs.

Show the media icons that give detailed information about resolution, video codec, audio codec, aspect ratio, etc. in most views. Showing these icons gives you more information about the highlighted media, but hiding these icons gives Revolve a cleaner look.
Reset all Revolve specific skin settings to the default values. This will delete all skin specific settings, including your custom Home Menu options!
Reload the current skin. This option is useful if you change the skin files while Kodi is running.

Set the source of the movie information that is displayed inside the circle of the Home Menu. Some sources require an add-on; these sources are unavailable when this add-on is not installed. The movie information is accessible from the 'Movies' option in the Home Menu (press left when 'Movies' is selected). If you select 'Nothing', the movie information will be unavailable.

Set the source of the episode information that is displayed inside the circle of the Home Menu. Some sources require an add-on; these sources are unavailable when this add-on is not installed. The episode information is accessible from the 'TV Shows' option in the Home Menu (press left when 'TV Shows' is selected). If you select 'Nothing', the episode information will be unavailable.

Set the source of the music album information that is displayed inside the circle of the Home Menu. Some sources require an add-on; these sources are unavailable when this add-on is not installed. The album information is accessible from the 'Albums' option in the Home Menu (press left when 'Albums' is selected). If you select 'Nothing', the album information will be unavailable.

Make this Home Menu option always open in the root folder. Some Home Menu options remember the last opened library or folder. These options reopen the view in this library or folder, and not in the root folder. You can bypass this behaviour with this setting. Activating this setting will always open the library in the root folder.
Show or hide the Revolve title screen on start-up.
Choose the busy animation for the progress bars.

Show the description of the currently selected item (like movies or albums) in the Landscape views. Showing the description gives you more information about the selected item, but hiding the description shows more fanart in the background.

Enable the TV option in the Home Menu. This option will only be visible in the Home Menu if the Personal Video Recorder (PVR) features are enabled. You can enable these PVR features in the Live TV settings.

Enable the Radio option in the Home Menu. This option will only be visible in the Home Menu if the Personal Video Recorder (PVR) features are enabled. You can enable these PVR features in the Live TV settings.
Enable on-screen debug information that shows the borders of the hidden lists in some views.
Enable a back button (in some views) to improve mouse navigation in Revolve. With this back button you can close the active view and return to a previous window.
Group the items in the Side Menu in logical units with a small header.
Draw a single color background behind the overlay information to increase the readability of the currently playing media.
Show the names of the unfocused thumbnails in the Thumbnails and Panels views. This gives the Thumbnails and Panels views a more cluttered look, but it is easier to navigate these views.
Select an animation level for animations in the background. These (useless) animations can be visible in the background of some views, around messages and in dialog windows.
Show or hide the help text in all the Settings windows.
Choose shape of icons in Thumbnails view:
This category contains the settings for how the backgrounds are handled.
This category contains the settings for how the options in the Home Menu are displayed. This includes turning options on or off, customizing pre-defined options, and adding new custom options.
This category contains the settings for how the circle menu inside the Home Menu is displayed. This includes the sources that populate these circle menus.
This category contains the settings for the default addons that Revolve uses.
This category contains miscellaneous settings that are used in Revolve. Several visual aspects of the Revolve skin can be configured here.
This category contains the debug settings for Revolve.
This category contains information about Revolve, including access to the changelog and the credits.
Choose the shapes of the icons in the Thumbnails views.
Set the name of the custom option that will appear in the menu.
Set the subtitle that will appear over the custom option in the menu.
Set the background image for the custom option in the menu.

Set the type of custom option that you want to create, the action associated with this custom option:[CR]- Custom submenu opens another menu, which you can fill with custom options. You can use the 'Edit Submenu' button to manage this submenu.[CR]- Custom items opens a window with items (such as movies, music albums) form a selected source, so you can fill a view with random albums or recommended episodes. You can use the 'Choose Items' button to select different sources for these items.[CR]- Custom action allows you to execute built-in functions from Kodi. You can use the 'Create Command' button to create these actions.
Set the name of the window that is opened by this custom option.

Set the source pattern that defines the properties that provide the items. The number in this pattern should be represented by '%d', so Revolve can extract the item-information from the properties and display them in a window.
Set the plug-in that provides the items. You should write down the complete call to the plug-in, including arguments, but you should exclude the 'plug-in://' part of the call.

Set the unique identifier of the submenu. The whole submenu is linked to this identifier. You can link an option to an existing submenu by copying the submenu's identifier, or you can loose a submenu by removing this identifier. An identifier should consist only of alphanumeric characters (so no spaces, no punctuation marks, no strange characters).
Set the Kodi built-in function that should be executed when this custom option is selected. You can edit this command or use the 'Create Command' button to create a new custom command.
Confirm the settings of this custom option and return to the Skin Settings menu.
Discard the changes made in the settings of this custom option and return to the Skin Settings menu.
Open the Custom Action Editor to create a new action for this custom option.
Open the Custom Items Editor to select a source to provide items for this custom option.
Open the Custom Submenu Editor to create or edit the submenu that is accessible through this custom command.
Clear all the settings for this custom command.
Enable or disable this help text.
Close the Custom Submenu Editor and return to the Custom Option Editor.
Enable this option in this submenu. You should provide a name and an action to make this custom option do something useful.
Edit this custom submenu option. You can set the name and subtitle of this option, and you can enter the action that is executed when this option is chosen in the submenu.
Use the scrollbar to quickly move through the list of options.

Set the type of custom option that you want to create, the action associated with this custom option:[CR]- Custom items opens a window with items (such as movies, music albums) form a selected source, so you can fill a view with random albums or recommended episodes. You can use the 'Choose Items' button to select different sources for these items.[CR]- Custom action allows you to execute built-in functions from Kodi. You can use the 'Create Command' button to create these actions.
Confirm the settings in this window and return to the Custom Option Editor.
Discard the changes made in this window and return to the Custom Option Editor.
Select the custom action that you want to connect to your custom option, or select the 'Custom Command' option in the list so you can enter a command.
Select the items for this custom action. The selected items will be displayed in a window when the associated custom action is selected.
Filter the list of items by the provider (the script or plug-in that provides the items) of the items.
Select the playlist that is used in the highlighted action.
Select the image that is used in the highlighted action.
Select the file that is used in the highlighted action.
Select the path that is used in the highlighted action.
Select the addon that is used in the highlighted action.
Enter the string that is used in the highlighted action.
Filter the list of actions by the kind of action that you want to create.
Enter a custom built-in command for this custom action.

Enable the exit menu in the circle of the Home Menu. This exit menu gives you fast access to all the exit options. If this menu is enabled, you can access it by pressing 'left' on the Exit-option in the Home Menu.
Enable the 'Next Aired' information in the circle of the Home Menu. If this option is enabled, you can access it by pressing 'left' on the Live TV-option in the Home Menu.
Shape of icons in thumbnails view
Update the video library with the selected path
Eject the tray in your device
Execute a shell command and wait
Reset all the settings on this page to their default values.
Are you sure that you want to reset these settings to their default values?
